content: Legend of the Holy Cross before Christ (fragments)

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 103r) Ðridde æt his wynstran sidan. On morgen þe he aras.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 103v) to þam tune þe genemned isrobathi.

objectDesc.extent:
219 mm x 163 mm (dimensions of all - size of leaf).
185 mm x 150 mm (dimensions of all - size of written space).

handDesc.summary: One hand writes the main text. The

hands.name: main text
hands.description: a small and round hand, using insular letter forms.

characters.note: e: high in the combination æ.
s: only long s is used.
ð: Round bowl with a long tapered ascender towards the left, a cross bar often starting midway from the ascender to the right.
descenders: elongated tapered to the left on the lower margin of the verso, as if they were used as page filler.

hands.name: additions
hands.description: Some punctuation, accents and diacritics by the

history.origin: Probably written in Worcester, as it contains glosses by the Tremulous Hand.
history.provenance: Probably remained in Worcester, and removed from the rest of the manuscript by Parker or Joscelyn.
history.acquisition: The book containing the sheet was acquired by the Spencer library in 1957 from Pearson's Book Rooms, Cambridge. It was found in the same book as Pryc.C2:2 (Collins 1976, pp. 48-9).

admin: Manuscript described by Orietta Da Rold with the assistance of Hollie Morgan and Johanna Green (2010; 2012) and with reference to facsimiles and published scholarship.
